page.title: 03GOODNESTONE
page.content: The countryside in which the parish of Goodnestone with Chillenden is set is of a rolling character. Arable farming is the main activity. There is also some sheep farming. The land is light_ ly wooded with a mixture of decidious trees and a variety of approaches to cultivation. These range from allowing woodland to mature and die to a posi_ tive management policy. Apart from the wooded areas, in general it is clear that agriculture policies of recent years have given the countryside a generally open appearance. There are very few hedges, or isolated trees, and cultivation takes place right up to the edge of the roads. To the north of the village the view towards Wing_ ham is dominated by a large silo. This is an E.E.C. intervention grain store.
